title: 107_s566
content: The "Economic Stimulus Act of 2001" is cited as the short title. It includes a reduction in income tax rates for individuals. The "Economic Stimulus Act of 2001" introduces rate reductions for taxable years beginning in 2001. The new lowest rate bracket sets a 10 percent tax rate on income not exceeding the initial bracket amount, with a 15 percent rate applying to income over that amount. The "Economic Stimulus Act of 2001" introduces rate reductions for taxable years beginning in 2001. The lowest rate bracket sets a 10 percent tax rate on income not exceeding the initial bracket amount, with a 15 percent rate applying to income over that amount. Adjustments to the tables prescribed under subsection (f) will be made to implement these changes. The amendments made by the Economic Stimulus Act of 2001 include rate reductions for taxable years starting in 2001. The changes affect various sections, such as section 1(h) and section 3402(p)(2), with effective dates beginning after December 31, 2000. The amendment to the withholding provision applies to amounts paid after the 60th day following the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. CREDIT AGAINST INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYMENT TAXES. Amends Subchapter B of chapter 65 to add a new section for a credit against individual employment taxes. The section provides a general rule for individuals to be treated as having made a payment against the tax imposed for the taxable year beginning in 2001. The payment amount is based on the taxpayer's liability for tax for the last taxable year in 2000 or $500, whichever is lesser. The liability for tax is defined as the taxpayer's social security taxes for the taxable year. The payment is deemed made on July 1, 2001, and the Secretary is required to remit the payment to each taxpayer on that date. The section excludes certain individuals, estates, trusts, and nonresident alien individuals from receiving the payment described in paragraph (1) on July 1, 2001. Amendments are made to title 31, United States Code, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65. The amendments made by this section, titled "Sec. 6428. Credit against individual employment taxes," will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
